basic_data.Description: PARENTING SKILLS INTO A COMMUNITY OF CARE FOR CHILDREN EXPOSED TO TRAUMA: TRAINING IN PC-CARE AND PC-CARE TOOLBOX - THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO DISSEMINATE AND EVALUATE TRAINING IN PC-CARE, A BRIEF PARENTING INTERVENTION FOR CHILDREN AGED 1-10 YEARS, AND PC-CARE TOOLBOX, AN ADAPTED MODEL FOR THE NON-MENTAL HEALTH WORKFORCE, AND TO REFINE TRAINING BY CREATING AN ONLINE RESOURCE, THE PC-CARE LEARNING CENTER. BOTH PC-CARE AND PC-CARE TOOLBOX ARE DESIGNED TO EDUCATE CAREGIVERS AND CHILDREN ABOUT THE EFFECTS OF TRAUMA ON CHILDREN AND TO TEACH AND PRACTICE POSITIVE COMMUNICATION SKILLS, CALMING SKILLS, AND EFFECTIVE BEHAVIOR MANAGEMENT STRATEGIES. POPULATION TO BE SERVED: WE WILL TRAIN APPROXIMATELY 320 LICENSABLE AND NON-LICENSABLE MENTAL HEALTH PROVIDERS IN PC-CARE AND 380 WORKERS IN CHILD-SERVING SYSTEMS IN PC-CARE TOOLBOX. WE WILL RECRUIT TRAINEES WHO WORK WITH 1-10 YEAR OLD CHILDREN IN UNDERSERVED REGIONS ACROSS THE UNITED STATES. WE WILL ENHANCE DISSEMINATION BY OFFERING A TRAIN-THE-TRAINER (TTT) PROGRAM.  STRATEGIES: WE WILL CREATE THE PC-CARE LEARNING CENTER, A WEB-BASED TRAINING PLATFORM TO HELP STANDARDIZE TRAINEES’ LEARNING ABOUT CHILD TRAUMA AND PRINCIPLES OF PC-CARE. TRAINEES WILL COMPLETE THE PC-CARE LEARNING CENTER AND ATTEND A VIRTUAL SKILL-BUILDING WORKSHOP. PC-CARE TRAINEES WILL RECEIVE 7 WEEKS OF GROUP CALLS, FOLLOWED BY INDIVIDUAL CALLS AND VIDEO-REVIEW FEEDBACK AS THEY PROVIDE PC-CARE TO CLIENTS. PC-CARE TOOLBOX TRAINEES WILL RECEIVE 6 BIWEEKLY GROUP CONSULTATION CALLS AS THEY WORK WITH FAMILIES. CERTIFIED PROVIDERS DESIRING PC-CARE TTT TRAINING WILL RECEIVE 9 BIWEEKLY GROUP CALLS AND SUPPORT AS THEY TRAIN ONE PROVIDER. PROJECT GOALS: THE PROJECT GOALS ARE: 1) RECRUITMENT AND AWARENESS: IMPROVE PUBLIC AWARENESS OF CHILD TRAUMA, TRAUMA-RELATED SCREENING AND INTERVENTION NEEDS, AND THE VALUE OF PC-CARE; 2) BUILDING TRAINING INFRASTRUCTURE: INCREASE PUBLIC ACCESS TO RESEARCH-BASED KNOWLEDGE OF CHILD TRAUMA AND PRINCIPLES OF PC-CARE WITH THE PC-CARE LEARNING CENTER; 3) TRAINING: TRAIN MENTAL HEALTH AND CHILD-SERVING PROVIDERS IN A PARENTING INTERVENTION, PC-CARE OR PC-CARE TOOLBOX, TO IMPROVE CHILDREN’S BEHAVIOR AND TRAUMA SYMPTOMS; SUSTAINING WITH PC-CARE TTT. MEASURABLE OBJECTIVES: THE SPECIFIC OBJECTIVES OF THIS PROJECT INCLUDE: 1A) CONDUCT 4 OUTREACH PRESENTATIONS PER YEAR; 1B) CONNECT WITH ALL NCTSN SITES SERVING 1-10 YEAR OLD CHILDREN; 2A) LAUNCH THE PC-CARE LEARNING CENTER; 2B) 700 INDIVIDUALS WILL COMPLETE THE PC-CARE LEARNING CENTER; 3A) TRAIN 320 MENTAL HEALTH PROVIDERS IN PC-CARE; 3B) TRAIN 380 CHILD-SERVING PROVIDERS IN PC-CARE TOOLBOX; 3C) CERTIFY 28 PC-CARE PROVIDERS AS TRAINERS IN TTT PROGRAM; 3D) INCREASE TRAINEE KNOWLEDGE AND CONFIDENCE IN WORKING WITH TRAUMATIZED CHILDREN WITH BEHAVIOR DIFFICULTIES; 3E) REDUCE TRAINEE SECONDARY TRAUMATIC STRESS; 3F) CHILDREN RECEIVING PC-CARE AND PC-CARE TOOLBOX WILL SHOW REDUCTIONS IN BEHAVIOR AND TRAUMA SYMPTOMS.
basic_data.Awarding Agency: Department of Health and Human Services
basic_data.Awarding Sub Agency: Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration
